Katoh, Misawa, Kuma, Miyata 2002 (Nucleic Acids Res. 30:3059-3066) MAFFT: a novel method for rapid multiple sequence alignment based on fast Fourier transform. (describes the FFT-NS-1, FFT-NS-2 and FFT-NS-i strategies) </reference>

format.python: ("", " -codonfile=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_codonfile.comment: <text lang="en">Optional codon usage file. Nucleotide sequences will be created as triplets matching the frequencies in the file, with the end trimmed to be in the correct reading frame.</text> </comment>

e_amount.prompt: Number of sequences created (value greater than or equal to 1)

format.python: ("", " -amount=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_length.prompt: Length of each sequence (value greater than or equal to 1)

format.python: ("", " -length=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_useinsert.prompt: Do you want to make an insert

e_insert.comment: <text lang="en">String that is inserted into sequence</text> </comment>

e_start.prompt: Start point of inserted sequence (value greater than or equal to 1)

format.python: ("", " -start=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_outseq.prompt: Name of the output sequence file (e_outseq)

format.python: ("", " -osformat=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment: <text lang="en">This program carries out the Fitch-Margoliash and Least Squares methods, plus a variety of others of the same family, with the assumption that all tip species are contemporaneous, and that there is an evolutionary clock (in effect, a molecular clock). This means that branches of the tree cannot be of arbitrary length, but are constrained so that the total length from the root of the tree to any species is the same.</text> </comment>
